articles.title: GPT-5 lowers the cost of cell-free protein synthesis

concepts_taught.name: Impact of large language models (LLMs) on scientific research
Cost reduction through AI in scientific processes

learning_outcomes: Understand how GPT-5 was integrated into a lab automation system.
Recognize the potential for AI to reduce costs in scientific research, specifically in cell-free protein synthesis.
Appreciate the concept of closed-loop experimentation driven by AI.
strategic_questions: What are the broader implications of AI-driven cost reductions in scientific research for drug discovery and other fields?
How might autonomous AI labs like this accelerate the pace of scientific breakthroughs?
What ethical considerations arise from increasing automation in scientific processes?

learning_outcomes: Understand the purpose of OpenAI Frontier as an enterprise platform.
Identify key features of OpenAI Frontier for managing AI agents.
Recognize the importance of shared context, onboarding, permissions, and governance in enterprise AI deployments.
strategic_questions: How might an enterprise platform like OpenAI Frontier address the challenges of scaling AI agent deployments within an organization?
What are the potential implications of centralized governance and permissions for the autonomy and flexibility of AI agents?

concepts_taught.name: AI-assisted information gathering for health decisions
Role of LLMs in patient empowerment
Complementary use of AI with expert medical advice

learning_outcomes: Understand how an LLM like ChatGPT can be used as a tool to help individuals research and prepare for complex health decisions.
Recognize the importance of using AI as a supplementary tool, not a replacement for professional medical expertise.
Appreciate the potential for AI to empower patients by providing accessible information.
strategic_questions: What are the ethical considerations when using AI to inform critical health decisions, even when alongside expert medical advice?
How can we ensure that information provided by LLMs is accurate and trustworthy, especially in sensitive domains like healthcare?
What are the long-term implications for patient-doctor relationships as AI tools become more integrated into healthcare information seeking?

articles.title: Unlocking the Codex harness: how we built the App Server

prerequisites.concept: Basic understanding of AI agent concepts

learning_outcomes: Understand the purpose and functionality of the Codex App Server.
Identify key features that enable advanced AI agent interactions (streaming progress, tool use, approvals, diffs).
Grasp how a JSON-RPC API can be used to integrate AI models into applications.
strategic_questions: What are the key trade-offs when designing a bidirectional streaming API for AI agents compared to a standard request-response model?
How might the concept of 'tool use' and 'approvals' implemented in the Codex App Server evolve in future AI applications?
Beyond code generation, what other AI agent capabilities would benefit significantly from streaming progress and explicit approval mechanisms?

articles.title: VfL Wolfsburg turns ChatGPT into a club-wide capability

concepts_taught.name: Leveraging LLMs for diverse business functions
Balancing AI integration with core identity

learning_outcomes: Understand how a professional sports club is implementing ChatGPT across various departments.
Grasp the importance of a people-centric approach to AI adoption.
See examples of how LLMs can enhance efficiency and creativity within an organization.
strategic_questions: Beyond efficiency, what are the potential long-term impacts of widespread LLM adoption on the 'football identity' of a club like VfL Wolfsburg?
What are the key challenges a non-tech organization might face when trying to replicate VfL Wolfsburg's approach to AI integration?

articles.title: Natively Adaptive Interfaces: A new framework for AI accessibility

prerequisites.concept: Basic understanding of User Interface (UI) design

learning_outcomes: Understand the concept of Natively Adaptive Interfaces (NAI).
Recognize how AI can be used to create more inclusive and accessible technology.
Appreciate the benefits of AI-driven personalization in user interfaces.
strategic_questions: Beyond the examples provided, what are other potential applications for Natively Adaptive Interfaces in different industries?
What are the potential ethical considerations or challenges in developing and deploying AI systems that heavily adapt to individual users?

learning_outcomes: Understand the purpose of OpenAI Frontier as an enterprise platform.
Identify key features of OpenAI Frontier for managing AI agents.
Recognize the importance of shared context, onboarding, permissions, and governance in enterprise AI deployments.
strategic_questions: How might an enterprise platform like OpenAI Frontier address the challenges of scaling AI agent deployments within an organization?
What are the potential implications of centralized governance and permissions for the autonomy and flexibility of AI agents?

concepts_taught.name: Controlled release of advanced AI capabilities

learning_outcomes: Understand OpenAI's approach to providing access to advanced cyber capabilities.
Recognize the importance of safeguards and trust-based frameworks in AI development.
Identify the tension between expanding AI access and preventing misuse.
strategic_questions: What are the potential benefits and risks of a 'trust-based framework' for accessing powerful AI capabilities?
How can organizations effectively balance the desire to democratize access to AI with the imperative to prevent its malicious use?

concepts_taught.name: Controlled release of advanced AI capabilities

learning_outcomes: Understand OpenAI's approach to providing access to advanced cyber capabilities.

Large Language Models (LLMs, transformer.name: Large Language Models (LLMs, transformers, GPT, Claude, Gemini, model architecture)

curriculum.topic: Large Language Models (LLMs, transformers, GPT, Claude, Gemini, model architecture)

concepts_taught.name: Integration of Different AI Strengths (Coding + Reasoning/Knowledge)

learning_outcomes: Understand that GPT-5.3-Codex is an advanced AI model designed for coding.
Recognize that the model integrates coding expertise with reasoning and general knowledge.
Grasp the concept of 'agentic' models in the context of AI for complex tasks.
strategic_questions: What are the potential implications of 'agentic coding models' for software development workflows?
How might the combination of coding performance and professional knowledge in GPT-5.3-Codex impact the role of human developers?
